source.1526271f:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import warnings
import time
import scipy.stats as stats
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
pd.set_option('display.max_rows',2000, 'display.max_columns',100)
Iron_Man = pd.read_csv("../input/iron-man-world-champhionship-allyears/Ironman World Championship.csv",encoding= 'unicode_escape')
source.44b87383:
fig = px.histogram(Iron_Man,x='Country',color="Place")
fig.update_xaxes(categoryorder="total descending",tickangle=270, tickfont=dict(size=14))
fig.update_layout(
    title='Most Winner blongs to this Countries')
fig.update_traces(marker_color='rgb(155,0,255)', marker_line_color='rgb(8,48,107)',
                  marker_line_width=1.5, opacity=0.6)
fig.show()
source.00726f79:
Winners_Time_in_Min = []
for i in Iron_Man['Time']:
    time_obj = time.strptime(i, '%H:%M:%S')
    Winners_Time_in_Min.append(time_obj.tm_hour * 60 + time_obj.tm_min +time_obj.tm_sec/60)
Iron_Man['Winners_Time_in_Min'] = Winners_Time_in_Min
source.bfc1fc3e:
Iron_Man_Male = Iron_Man[Iron_Man['Gender']=='Male']
Iron_Man_Male['Year'] = Iron_Man_Male['Year'].astype(float)
fig = px.treemap(Iron_Man_Male, path=['Country','Athlete','Place','Year','Time'],hover_data=['Athlete','Place','Year','Time'],color='Country')
fig.update_layout(
    title='Iron Man Male Winiing Position-1,Position-2 and Position-3 with Detail')
fig.show()
source.d4cef6ca:
Iron_Man_Male_1 = Iron_Man_Male[Iron_Man_Male['Place']==1]
Iron_Man_Male_1.reset_index(inplace = True) 

Z1 = Iron_Man_Male_1['Country'].value_counts().keys()
Z2 = Iron_Man_Male_1['Country'].value_counts()

fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Scatter(
    x=Z1,
    y=Z2,
    mode='markers',
    marker=dict(
        size=[100,50,35,15,15],
        color=[100,50,35,15,15],
        showscale=True
        )
)])
fig.update_layout(
    title='Countries Winning 1st Place in Male Ironman Trialathon Race',
    xaxis_title="Countries",
    yaxis_title="Winners Count",
)
fig.show()

fig = px.histogram(Iron_Man_Male_1,x='Athlete',color='Country')
fig.update_layout(
    title='Iron Man 1st Place Winner')
fig.update_xaxes(categoryorder="total descending",tickangle=270, tickfont=dict(size=14))
fig.show()

source.0ce3e8df:
print("Fastest Player to complete Men's Iron Man")
print('_________________________________________________________________________________')
print("                                    ")
Iron_Man_Men_Fast=Iron_Man_Male.iloc[Iron_Man_Male.groupby(['Gender'])['Winners_Time_in_Min'].idxmin()][['Year','Place','Country','Athlete','Time','Winners_Time_in_Min']]
print(Iron_Man_Men_Fast)
print("                                    ")
print('=================================================================================')
print("Slowest Player to complete Men's Iron Man")
print('_________________________________________________________________________________')
print("                                    ")
Iron_Man_Men_Slow=Iron_Man_Male.iloc[Iron_Man_Male.groupby(['Gender'])['Winners_Time_in_Min'].idxmax()][['Year','Place','Country','Athlete','Time','Winners_Time_in_Min']]
print(Iron_Man_Men_Slow)
print("                                    ")
print('=================================================================================')

source.b4633a89: Most 2nd Place winners Scott Tinley from USA respectively, winning 2nd place 4 times.
source.87001e05: Most 3rd Place are Pauli Kiuru from Finland, Greg Welch from Australia, Cameron Brown from New Zealand, Jeff Tinley from USA, Scott Tinley from USA, Jeff Devlin from USA, David McNamee from Great Britain, Lothar Leder from Germany, Faris Al-Sultan from Germany, Andreas Raelert from Germany and Sebastian Kienele from Germany, winnig 3rd place 2 times.
source.e453af83: Paula Newby-Fraser of Zimbawe is most suceesful winning 7 Titles of Iron Man Womens
source.675b45c6: Most successful Male Ironman Trialathon winner are Dave Scott and Mark Allen winnig 6 times.
source.9e14d4c0: Lori Bowden from Canada has won 2nd place 4 times
source.9a11833f: Ironman Triathlon is organized by world Triathlon Corporation. It consist of 2.4 mile swim, 112 mile bicycle ride and a marathon of 26.22 mile run, race should be in same sequence.It is considered to be one of the most toughest One Day Sports Event, this sports requires strong Mental and Fit Body so that you can surpass the toughest sport on that given date.
source.4a33b5f1: Fernanda Keller from Brazil has won 3rd Place in Iron Man Womens 6 times.
